item.title: Man Who Introduced Millions to Bitcoin Says Blockchain Is a Bust
item.description:
Man Who Introduced Millions to Bitcoin Says Blockchain Is a Bust

Stefan Thomas, who introduced millions of people to bitcoin, has had a change of heart. Blockchain, the ledger software that makes the digital currency possible, is too rigid to gain wide adoption, he wrote in an essay titled " The Subtle Tyranny of Blockchain."

item.title: Safe, Not Sorry: How to Treat Cloud Mining Right
item.description:
Safe, Not Sorry: How to Treat Cloud Mining Right

Cloud mining, according to some, is one of the most profitable ways of investing online. Many users are aware of such opportunity and actively use it. Others think that 'making money from nothing' is nothing more than fraud. As always, the truth lies somewhere in between.

item.title: The Next Bitcoin Software Release Will Be the First to Feature SegWit Code - CoinDesk
item.description:
The Next Bitcoin Software Release Will Be the First to Feature SegWit Code - CoinDesk

A forthcoming bitcoin software update will be the first to feature code that could be later activated and included as part of an effort to scale transaction capacity on the bitcoin blockchain.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Holds Above $550 Support
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Holds Above $550 Support

Bitcoin price has halted decline and may have found support at the $555 (Bitstamp) level. The 4-hour candle chart shows that advance is possible, but that a critical watershed for decline remains close-by. This analysis is provided by xbt.social with a 3-hour delay. Read the full analysis here. Not a member?

item.title: Blocktrail Set to Launch 'Most Used Bitcoin App in Whole Industry'
item.description:
Blocktrail Set to Launch 'Most Used Bitcoin App in Whole Industry'

Following its acquisition by one of the world's leading companies in the Bitcoin space, Bitmain, Blocktrail is rebranding to BTC.com and it will be doing localized marketing. Alejandro De La Torre, business development at Blocktrail, explains to CoinTelegraph: "We will be translating our bitcoin wallet and site into many different languages.

item.title: Meet our Interns: Summer 2016
item.description:
Meet our Interns: Summer 2016

For many, Labor Day is the sign of summer coming to an end. At Blockchain, we were hit with that reality last week when we said good said goodbye to (most of) our summer interns. These great young talents have, in the course of a couple of months, contributed to Blockchain and the bitcoin ecosystem as a whole in significant and extremely meaningful ways.

item.title: Japan Risks Falling Behind Amid Blockchain Talent Shortage
item.description:
Japan Risks Falling Behind Amid Blockchain Talent Shortage

While the rest of the globe is on pace to grasp this technology in hopes that it could transform financial markets, Japan is lacking specialized technicians to develop their own blockchain industry. Also read:Popular Bitcoin Investing App Keza to Relaunch Japan has a shortage of developers and programmers that specialize in blockchain technology solutions, according to Reuters.

item.title: How to build a bitcoin trading bot
item.description:
How to build a bitcoin trading bot

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. Join them; it only takes a minute: Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top I'd like to experiment with bitcoin technology, crypto currency, and encryption.

item.title: Rakuten Acquires Bitcoin Startup Team for Blockchain Lab Launch - CoinDesk
item.description:
Rakuten Acquires Bitcoin Startup Team for Blockchain Lab Launch - CoinDesk

Japanese e-commerce firm Rakuten is opening a blockchain development lab in the UK, a move that follows its acquisition of former employees at bitcoin payments startup Bitnet. Former Bitnet employees Stephen McNamara and Fergal Downey will spearhead the Belfast-based operation, which Rakuten said today will be focused on blockchain technology and FinTech more broadly.
